sentence.Network_en: The decision will be relayed to Iraq's ambassador at the UN.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个决定将会被传达给伊拉克驻联合国大使。

sentence.Network_en: Also among the speakers was the new American ambassador to Moscow.
sentence.Network_cn: 发言者当中还有驻莫斯科的新任美国大使。

sentence.Network_en: I've been invited to meet with the American Ambassador.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from French ambassadeur, from Italian ambasciator, based on Latin ambactus 'servant'

entry.def: An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.

means.word_mean: 1. a diplomat of the highest rank; accredited as representative from one country to another

auth_sentence.content: The ambassador spoke on NBC's Meet the Press.

sentences.en: He is the Chinese ambassador to Japan.

jushi.english: He has been appointed as ambassador to the United Nations.
jushi.chinese: 他已被任命为驻联合国大使。

jushi.english: Sportsmen who play abroad should remember that they are ambassadors of their country.
jushi.chinese: 到国外参赛的运动员应当记住,他们是自己国家的代表。

jushi.english: He was the France ambassador in〔at〕 Tokyo.
jushi.chinese: 他曾是法国驻东京大使。
